title: Little River Canyon National Preserve: Park Home
body: A special place in the Southern Appalachians  Little River is unique because it flows for most of its length atop Lookout Mountain in northeast Alabama. Forested uplands, waterfalls, canyon rims and bluffs, pools, boulders, and sandstone cliffs offer settings for a variety of recreational activities. Natural resources and cultural heritage come together to tell the story of the Preserve, a special place in the Southern Appalachians.              Exploring Mushroom Rock   Help your child explore their world. Show them the beauty nature has to offer and teach them how to protect parks for future generations.            Little River Canyon from Wolf Overlook   Enjoy the spectacular views of Little River Canyon from the Overlooks.        Little River Falls   Little River Falls located on AL Hwy 35 is pretty in any season.        Snakes have a home at the Preserve   Black Snakes and other animals call the park home. Please respect them.            Little River Falls in the Winter Season   Little River Falls in the Winter Season
